summary: This document is an email chain between attorneys regarding the filing of a November 15, 2021 letter to Judge Nathan on the public docket and the sharing of a defense motion seeking a subpoena for Jordana Feldman. It involves coordination between government and defense counsel on redactions and confidentiality designations.

persons.name: Brian Burns
persons.context: Attorney from Smith Villazor LLP corresponding with defense and government counsel about filing a letter to Judge Nathan and requesting a copy of a defense motion.

persons.name: Jeff Pagliuca
persons.context: Defense counsel who responds regarding the defense motion, notes confidentiality designations, and defers to the government on sharing the document.

persons.name: Christian Everdell
persons.context: Attorney from Cohen & Gresser LLP who sends the signed subpoena for Jordana Feldman to other counsel.

persons.name: Laura Menninger
persons.context: Attorney copied on emails regarding the subpoena and defense motion.

persons.name: Patrick J. Smith
persons.context: Author of a November 15, 2021 letter to Judge Nathan that is to be filed on the public docket.

persons.name: Judge Nathan
persons.context: Federal judge presiding over the case, to whom a November 15, 2021 letter is addressed.

persons.name: Jordana Feldman
persons.context: Individual who is the subject of a subpoena sought by the defense.

persons.name: Bobbi Sternheim
persons.context: Attorney whose confidentiality notice is appended to an email from Christian Everdell.

connections.description: Correspond regarding the sharing of a defense motion and redaction procedures, showing they are opposing counsel in the case.
Everdell copies Pagliuca on an email sending a signed subpoena, indicating they are both involved in the defense's legal efforts.
Everdell copies Burns on an email regarding a subpoena, indicating Burns is a government attorney corresponding with defense counsel.
Both are copied on the same emails regarding the subpoena and motion, suggesting they are co-counsel or part of the same defense team.

events.title: Letter to Judge Nathan
events.description: Patrick J. Smith sends a letter to Judge Nathan, which is to be filed on the public docket by November 21, 2021.

events.title: Subpoena for Jordana Feldman Sent
events.description: Christian Everdell sends a signed subpoena for Jordana Feldman to other counsel.

events.title: Coordination on Defense Motion
events.description: Email exchange between Brian Burns, Jeff Pagliuca, and others regarding the defense's motion seeking the subpoena and confidentiality concerns.

locations: 800 Third Avenue, New York, NY 10022 (Cohen & Gresser LLP office)
keyFacts: A November 15, 2021 letter from Patrick J. Smith to Judge Nathan was required to be filed on the public docket by November 21, 2021, with no redactions intended by the filing party.
The defense sought a subpoena for Jordana Feldman, and there was a motion related to this subpoena that the government had not seen.
The government had designated all its productions as confidential under a protective order, and the defense motion contained such confidential information, requiring government approval for sharing.
The email chain shows procedural coordination and confidentiality protocols between government and defense attorneys in the ongoing case.
